titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Sharon Cumberland writes poetry and teaches American Literature and Poetry at Seattle University. She earned her Ph.D. in English from the City University of New York. She has had poems published in Ploughshares, Beloit Poetry Journal, the Iowa Review, and Verse.

scopecontent.p: The Sharon Cumberland papers consist of material dating from 1963 to 1994. Of particular interest are Cumberland's journals, which range from 1963 to 1978. Included in the journals are records of her time at the Catholic Worker and her interactions with a number of notable people including Dorothy Day. The collection also includes Cumberland's notes from her psychotherapy sessions, as well as correspondence, typescripts, notebooks, research files, photographs, and clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/cumberla.htm.
